articles.headline: House G.O.P. Leaders Agree to Extension of Payroll Tax Cut
articles.snippet: Republican leaders bowed to intense pressure from members of their party to end a politically damaging impasse, agreeing to accept a two-month extension of a payroll tax holiday.
articles.abstract: Republican leaders bowed to intense pressure from members of their party to end a politically damaging impasse, agreeing to accept a two-month extension of a payroll tax holiday.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Bowing under intense pressure from members of their own party, House Republican leaders agreed Thursday to accept a temporary extension of the payroll tax cut, beating a hasty retreat from a showdown that Republicans increasingly saw as a threat to their election opportunities next year.

articles.headline: In Europe, Juggling Image and Capital
articles.snippet: Santander and other European banking giants are trying to preserve their brands while dealing with government austerity and tighter rules that threaten to plunge the Continent back into recession.
articles.abstract: Santander and other European banking giants are trying to preserve their brands while dealing with government austerity and tighter rules that threaten to plunge the Continent back into recession.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Stung by souring loans and troubled government bond portfolios, many European banks are being forced by regulators to raise money to build up their cash cushions against future losses.

articles.headline: Retailers Are Slashing Prices Ahead of Holiday
articles.snippet: Aggressive last-minute deals are good for bargain hunters, but they could be an alarm bell for the retail industry.
articles.abstract: Aggressive last-minute deals are good for bargain hunters, but they could be an alarm bell for the retail industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Half off at the entire store at Ann Taylor. Sixty percent at Gap. Forty percent off almost everything at Abercrombie & Fitch.

articles.headline: Exxon Spars With Iraq Over Lack of Payment
articles.snippet: An oil deal in Kurdistan could be delaying a $50 million payment that Exxon Mobil wants from the Iraq government for improvements it made to an oil field.
articles.abstract: An oil deal in Kurdistan could be delaying a $50 million payment that Exxon Mobil wants from the Iraq government for improvements it made to an oil field.
articles.lead_paragraph: The turmoil in Iraq after the United States troop withdrawal is extending to its vital petroleum industry.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Julia Werdigier

articles.headline: How to Control Libya Missiles? Buy Them Up
articles.snippet: Talks between the United States and Libya are the latest effort to account for thousands of portable antiaircraft missiles missing after rebels overran arms depots.
articles.abstract: Talks between the United States and Libya are the latest effort to account for thousands of portable antiaircraft missiles missing after rebels overran arms depots.
articles.lead_paragraph: TRIPOLI, Libya — The United States is discussing with the Libyan interim government the creation of a program to purchase shoulder-fired, heat-seeking missiles from militia members and others who gathered them up during the war, American government officials said.

articles.headline: New Law School Sues Bar Association
articles.snippet: The Duncan School of Law in Tennessee filed a suit after being denied accreditation by the ﻿﻿American Bar Association, accusing it of antitrust violations and of depriving the school of due process.
articles.abstract: The Duncan School of Law in Tennessee filed a suit after being denied accreditation by the ﻿﻿American Bar Association, accusing it of antitrust violations and of depriving the school of due process.
articles.lead_paragraph: A law school in Tennessee that was denied accreditation by the American Bar Association sued the organization on Thursday, accusing it of antitrust violations and of depriving the school of due process.

articles.headline: Stores Remove Formula After Boy Dies
articles.snippet: Walmart and Supervalu have removed Enfamil, a popular brand of infant formula, from thousands of stores after a Missouri infant who consumed the product died.
articles.abstract: Walmart and Supervalu have removed Enfamil, a popular brand of infant formula, from thousands of stores after a Missouri infant who consumed the product died.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two major retail chains, including Walmart, have removed certain packages of Enfamil, a popular brand of infant formula, from thousands of stores after a Missouri infant who consumed the product died from a rare bacterial infection.

articles.headline: New Models of Implants Not Better, Study Finds
articles.snippet: Not a single new artificial hip or knee introduced over a recent five-year period was any more durable than older ones. In fact, 30 percent of them fared worse.
articles.abstract: Not a single new artificial hip or knee introduced over a recent five-year period was any more durable than older ones. In fact, 30 percent of them fared worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that the recent technology for artificial hips and knees did not perform any better than older, less expensive designs.
